title: I'm A Celeb: Chris Packham calls on Ant and Dec to stop animal cruelty
text:
It’s not the first time the wildlife presenter has had something to say about the animal cruelty on the show(Picture: Rex)

Chris Packham wants I’m A Celebrity…Get Me Out Of Here to stop ‘killing animals for entertainment’.

The TV presenter has slammed the ITV show for their use of animals during the Bushtucker trials – and has admitted that he wants to speak to Ant and Dec about the issue.

And despite wanting to air his views with the Geordie duo, he revealed his real problem is with the I’m A Celeb bosses.

He told the Daily Mirror newspaper: ‘When I see them being harmed or killed for entertainment, I wonder if we are not in the Middle Ages. It’s about change. People have to accept that we have to make changes now.

‘I have never met Ant and Dec but rest assured if I did, I would be chatting about it. But it’s the programme producers I’d really like to get into a room.’

Emily gets a face full of bugs in a Bushtucker trial last year (Picture: ITV)

Remember when Katie Price had to do this? (Picture: REX/ITV)

The show came under fire in 2017 when Vanessa White and Jennie McAlpine had to keep animals in their mouths while humming for a Bushtucker trial.

An ITV spokesman said at the time: ‘As a production, I’m a Celebrity complies with all regional and national laws concerning the use of insects animals and reptiles.’

It’s not the first time Springwatch presenter has aired his views about the animal cruelty on show.

Earlier in October, Chris explained that wanted to talk to show bosses about how they include animals in the future, accusing them of ‘stereotyping’ snakes and cockroaches.

He told Metro.co.uk: ‘The time I spend making TV programmes I’m trying to engender an affinity for life. It’s not just about the cute and the cuddly, it’s about everything because everything is necessary. So it’s about snakes it’s about spiders, it’s about cockroaches.

‘What I object to on the programme is the ongoing stereotyping of these animals as being things which are dirty, disgusting, poisonous dangerous and so on and so forth. And that’s counterproductive to everything that I do.

‘We don’t have wild animals in the circus any more, we don’t like animals being used for that sort of entertainment any more. So why would we countenance it on a TV programme?

‘I plan to write them another letter saying, “can I come and talk to you, can we come up with a solution whereby your programme is no less entertaining and popular and you don’t stereotype and abuse animals?”.’

He also publicly blasted the ITV reality show for ‘abusing animals’ at the TV Choice Awards in September.

I’m A Celebrity…Get Me Out Of Here! returns to ITV in November.
